title: Slovakian ice-skating nun takes internet by storm
title_page: Slovakian ice-skating nun takes internet by storm | Daily Mail Online
text:
An ice skating nun is taking the world by storm after her amazing display of skill in Slovakia went viral on the internet.
The nun in question was videoed with several of her sisters in the capital Bratislava dressed in their full habits skating gracefully at a public rink.
But she stood out among the rest after showing off techniques more suited to the Winter Olympics including a 12-spin pirouette.
Maria Pavla Hudacekova, pictured, is taking the world by storm with her ice skating display in Slovakia
Sister Maria of Ursulines of the Roman Union wows the crowds with her tricks while dressed in full habit
She was joined by 10 fellow nuns on the ice but stood out with jumps, twirls and pirouettes
It was later revealed the figure skating nun - Maria Pavla Hudacekova or Sister Maria of Ursulines of the Roman Union, was a former junior champion skater in her youth.
The video was taken by a teenager watching his young sister perform on the ice - until he noticed the astonishing sight unfolding before him.
David Fico wrote a story about it on his blog 'May Dave Blog', where he likened what he witnessed to the Hollywood movie 'Sister Act'.
David wrote: 'More than 10 nuns appeared on ice and started ice skating. It was too hilarious for words, but also strange at the same time.
'I felt so... I don't even know how to describe that feeling. And what really what touched me the most was that they were all so happy.
'I could feel the happiness that shone from them. They appreciated the moment, ice skating around each other. And they were all really pretty!
Sister Maria was revealed to have been a junior champion skater in her youth and still practices today
'One of the nuns started figure skating. It was so nice and suddenly my little sister asked her to teach her some skating skills too.'
Sister Maria told Christian news website Zasvateny Zivot: 'I did not like ice skating races, but I liked to perform. My joy was in the audience.'
She said she took her holy orders a decade ago after a difficult end to a love affair, but still finds time for her favourite hobby around her spiritual duties.
She said: 'I used to hold religious meetings with ice hockey players. I spoke to them about Jesus and supported them.'
